item.title: Kia Syros Could Get An EV Version Soon, Launch Expected In 2026 - CarDekho
item.description:
Kia Syros Could Get An EV Version Soon, Launch Expected In 2026

Publication Date: N/A | Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros is set to potentially launch its all-electric version in India by 2026, competing with other EVs like Tata Nexon EV and Mahindra XUV400 EV, and expected to offer a driving range of approximately 400 km.

  • The Syros EV will likely be based on the reinforced K1 platform.
  • Design updates may include EV-specific features like revised bumpers.
  • The cabin layout will remain largely unchanged with EV-specific accents.
  • Expected pricing starts from Rs 15 lakh (ex-showroom).
“Although Kia is yet to reveal the battery pack and electric motor specifications for the Syros EV, we expect it to offer a claimed driving range of around 400 km.”

The Syros EV aims to incorporate the familiar features of its ICE counterpart while introducing elements unique to electric vehicles, marking a significant shift in Kia's offerings in the Indian market.

item.title: Stock Market Crash: Nifty posts worst week of 2024, losing ₹19 lakh crore of investor wealth - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stock Market Crash: Nifty posts worst week of 2024, losing ₹19 lakh crore of investor wealth

Date: October 2024 Source: Economic Times

The Nifty 50 index ended with significant losses, marking its worst week of 2024 and leading to a loss of nearly ₹19 lakh crore in investor wealth.

  • The Nifty 50 index dropped over 350 points on Friday.
  • 48 out of 50 Nifty stocks ended the week with losses.
  • The Sensex lost nearly 1,200 points during the same period.
  • IT stocks declined despite positive guidance from Accenture Plc.
  • Global market concerns from the US Federal Reserve's hawkish outlook affected investor sentiment.
  • Some stocks hit 52-week lows, including Reliance Industries and Tata Consumer Products.
  • Experts are watching critical support levels for potential market rebounds.
“The market has been going through a little bit of turmoil... but in case, these levels do not hold, then I think that is a further slide towards 23,200 to 22,500.” - Vaishali Parekh, Prabhudas Lilladher

In conclusion, while the current market conditions are challenging, experts suggest a potential recovery, driven by government expenditure in the upcoming months.

item.title: Raghuram Rajan Blames UPA Corruption For Bank NPAs, Lauds Modi Government’s Write-Offs - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Raghuram Rajan Blames UPA Corruption For Bank NPAs, Lauds Modi Government’s Write-Offs

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: Bloomberg Quint

In a recent interview, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan attributed the rise in bank non-performing assets (NPAs) to corruption during the UPA government. He commended the Modi administration for its efforts in resolving these issues and helping banks recover.

  • Rajan claims UPA-era corruption was a primary cause of NPAs.
  • He recounted a conversation with Arun Jaitley regarding the need to address bad loans.
  • Post-financial crisis challenges included project troubles and regulatory delays.
  • Rajan emphasized the need for a thorough asset quality review of banks to identify bad loans.
  • He highlighted the importance of bank cleanups to restore lending capabilities.
"It was necessary to clean up the system; otherwise lending would be hampered." - Raghuram Rajan

This analysis by Rajan underscores the importance of accountability and systematic reform in addressing long-standing financial issues in India's banking sector.

item.title: Infosys' 'New Year gift' to West Bengal, here's what CM Mamata Banerjee said - The Times of India
item.description:
Infosys' New Year Gift to West Bengal: Statements from CM Mamata Banerjee

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

Infosys has announced significant investments in West Bengal as a 'New Year gift'. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed gratitude and highlighted the positive impact on the state's economy and employment.

  • Infosys to create thousands of job opportunities in West Bengal.
  • The investment is seen as a boost to the local economy and IT sector.
  • CM Mamata Banerjee emphasizes collaboration between the state government and IT industry.
'This investment will significantly enhance the employment landscape in our state,' said CM Mamata Banerjee.

This investment from Infosys is expected to reinforce West Bengal's position as a key IT hub in India.

item.title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700 - The Times of India
item.description:
Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700

Date: Today
Source: Times of India

Indian equity benchmark indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 faced significant declines today, dipping below 78,500 and just above 23,700 respectively. Key factors include recent comments from the US Federal Reserve affecting investor confidence.

  • BSE Sensex declined by 836 points (1.06%) to 78,382.17.
  • Nifty50 dropped by 241 points (1.01%) to 23,710.95.
  • Foreign investors sold shares worth 122.31 billion rupees ($1.44 billion) this week.
  • Weekly declines of both indices exceed 3%, marking the first drop after four weeks of gains.
  • Top gainers included Asian Paints, Nestle India, and Titan Company, while major losers were Tech Mahindra and Axis Bank.
“Despite the weakness, oversold conditions and resilience in select pockets present buying opportunities.” - Ajit Mishra, SVP, Research, Religare Broking

In conclusion, the current pressure on the stock market can be attributed to global economic conditions, particularly the US Federal Reserve's recent statements on interest rates, prompting caution among investors.

item.title: NTPC Green, Waaree Energies, Inox Wind, Adani Green: How renewable energy stocks performed this week - Upstox
item.description:
Waaree Energies, NTPC Green and other renewable energy stocks tumble this week; check details

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: Upstox

This week saw significant declines in the stock prices of major renewable energy companies, despite their announcements regarding new facilities and orders.

  • NTPC Green Energy shares fell by 8.64% to ₹131.
  • KPI Green Energy managed a 1.2% increase, closing at ₹802.
  • Adani Green Energy shares plunged 13.69% to ₹1,030.
  • Waaree Energies shares dropped 10.5% to ₹2,871.
  • Premier Energies saw a slight increase of 0.12%, closing at ₹1,296.
“On the basis of certificate dated 18 December 2024 issued by Gujarat Energy Development Agency, second part capacity of 30 MW out of 150 MW Gujarat Solar PV Project is declared on commercial operation.”

Despite positive announcements in the sector, overall market conditions have led to a week of poor performance for renewable energy stocks.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart share price today: Rs 1175 cr bulk deal impact? THESE are top sellers and buyers - ET Now
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart share price today: Rs 1175 cr bulk deal impact? THESE are top sellers and buyers

Updated Dec 19, 2024, Source: ET NOW News

The shares of Vishal Mega Mart saw significant trading activity and high volatility following its IPO.

  • Shares rose 43.50% on the opening day, but fell 5.43% the following day.
  • Initial listing price was Rs 110 on BSE, with a peak rise to Rs 115.60.
  • The IPO raised Rs 8,000-crore, massively oversubscribed at 27.28 times.
“The overall amount of these large deals is about Rs 1175.27 crore.”

The bulk deal activity involved major players making significant purchases and sales of shares.

item.title: If you share your Amazon Prime Video account with your family, there are 2 new rules you should know about - India Today
item.description:
Amazon has two new rules that you should know about if you share your Amazon Prime account with friends or family.

Published On: Dec 20, 2024 | Published By: Nandini Yadav

Starting January 2025, Amazon Prime subscribers who share their accounts will face new restrictions on device logins that limit streaming capabilities.

  • Users can log in to a maximum of 5 devices, with only 2 allowed to be televisions.
  • Subscribers can remove and replace up to 2 devices every 30 days.
  • The aim is to enhance account security and manage device sharing more effectively.
“As part of your Prime membership, you and your household are entitled to enjoy Prime Video on up to five devices.”

The new policy comes as Amazon adjusts its service terms in India, following in the footsteps of similar restrictions from other streaming services.

item.title: Google Layoffs: Sundar Pichai announces major job cuts, 10% of managerial roles to be eliminated, report says - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Google Announces Major Layoffs, Cutting 10% of Managerial Roles

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Amid increasing competition in the AI sector, Google has announced significant job cuts, eliminating 10% of its managerial roles as part of an effort to enhance operational efficiency.

  • CEO Sundar Pichai disclosed the layoffs during an all-hands meeting.
  • This decision affects directors and VPs as part of a broader restructuring initiative.
  • The layoff process has been ongoing since 2022, with previous cuts affecting over 12,000 employees.
  • Pichai emphasized the need to focus on 'Googleyness,' clarifying key principles such as mission-driven work and teamwork.
  • The tech industry is witnessing a trend of streamlining operations in response to the growing influence of AI.
“The time has come for Google to focus more on updating modern Google.”

This latest round of layoffs reflects Google's ongoing strategy to remain competitive in a rapidly evolving tech landscape.

item.title: Siemens India shares see a sharp fall of up to 8% — Explained - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Siemens India shares see a sharp fall of up to 8% — Explained

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of Siemens India Ltd. have seen a significant fall of up to 8% following comments made during a post-earnings call regarding the state of private capital expenditure.

  • Shares are currently down 13% from their recent peak.
  • Private capex has not shown meaningful improvement overall.
  • Strong demand noted in the energy business, particularly in the transmission segment due to renewables.
  • Company not participating in LCC tenders but remains active in the VSC segment.
  • Digital industries facing challenges due to semiconductor shortages and destocking.
  • Current trading price is ₹7,047, down from a peak of ₹8,129.
Management expects recovery in the digital industries business in the coming quarters.

The decline in Siemens India's shares reflects broader challenges in private capital expenditure and supply chain disruptions; however, growth in certain sectors offers a glimmer of hope.

item.title: Rs 201 IPO GMP Today: Latest grey market premium on FIRE - Check company name - ET Now
item.description:
Mamata Machinery IPO Shows Strong Grey Market Premium

Updated: December 20, 2024 12:52 IST | Source: ET NOW

Mamata Machinery, a Gujarat-based packaging equipment manufacturer, has seen its IPO trading at a high grey market premium, indicating potential for strong listing gains.

  • The Mamata Machinery IPO opened on December 19 and will close on December 23.
  • The IPO price band is set between Rs 230 and Rs 243.
  • The current grey market premium is Rs 201, suggesting a possible listing at Rs 444 per share, representing around an 82% gain.
  • Ahead of the IPO, the company raised Rs 53 crore from anchor investors.
  • The IPO consists entirely of an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 73.82 lakh equity shares, totaling Rs 179.38 crore at the upper price band.
  • Listing is expected on both NSE and BSE, with trading commencing thereafter.
“The Mamata Machinery shares could deliver a bumper listing gain of around 82 percent.”

Investors are advised to consider their financial positions carefully before participating in the IPO, as the article is intended for informational purposes only.

item.title: MTAR Technologies, Prataap Snacks, Exide Industries, Amara Raja, Vakrangee, Sagility India: Check top buzzing stocks of the day - Upstox
item.description:
Top Buzzing Stocks of the Day: MTAR Technologies, Prataap Snacks, and More

Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: Upstox

The stock market indices faced a downturn on December 20, 2023. Here are the notable stocks making waves in today's trading session.

  • MTAR Technologies: Shares up nearly 8% after receiving ₹226 crore orders in clean energy and aerospace sectors.
  • Bharti Airtel: Shares rose 0.37% after prepaying ₹3,626 crore for spectrum liabilities.
  • Prataap Snacks: Shares up over 8%, trading at ₹1,104.50 apiece.
  • Exide Industries: Flat with a positive bias, related to agreements for EV battery production.
  • Amara Raja Energy: Nearly 1% higher as it partners with Hyundai for battery technology.
  • RBL Bank: Shares fell over 4%, following earnings forecasts cut by Morgan Stanley.
  • LTIMindtree: Down over 3.5% in trading.
  • Vakrangee: Shares up 6% after partnering with Canara Bank for banking services.
  • Sagility India: Locked in a 5% upper circuit limit; positive growth expectations set by Jefferies.

item.title: Supreme Court Sets Aside NCDRC Judgment Barring Banks From Charging More Than 30% Interest On Credit Card ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Overturns NCDRC's 30% Interest Cap on Credit Cards

Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: Indian Kanoon

The Supreme Court has set aside a 2008 National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission (NCDRC) decision that established a 30% cap on interest rates charged by banks on credit cards, citing it as an excessive rate.

  • The NCDRC previously deemed interest rates over 30% as usurious following comparisons with international rates.
  • The Supreme Court's ruling allows banks more flexibility in setting interest rates above the previously established limit.
  • The case involves the HONGKONG AND SHANGHAI BANKING CORP. LTD. and other parties.
“Charging of interest in excess of 30 per cent shall be considered usuries rate of interest and that if such rate of interest is charged, it would amount to unfair trade practice.”

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's decision marks a significant change in the regulation of credit card interest rates in India, potentially leading to higher costs for consumers.

item.title: Top Buy Calls: These stocks may surge up to 50% as per analysts - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Top Buy Calls: These stocks may surge up to 50% as per analysts

Date: March 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

Analysts have projected potential upside of up to 50% for several stocks, with coverage initiations revealing bullish sentiments across various companies.

  • Anant Raj: Price target of ₹1,100, potential upside of 31%. Stock gained 190% this year.
  • Motilal Oswal: Price target of ₹1,200, potential upside of 26%. Stock gained 199% this year.
  • Swiggy: Price target of ₹730, potential upside of 27%. Recent IPO price surged 50% from ₹390.
  • MTAR Tech: Price target of ₹2,100, potential upside of 31%. Stock has lost 20% this year but recently won orders worth ₹226 crore.
  • Piramal Pharma: Price target of ₹340, potential upside of 36%. Stock gained 90% so far in 2024.
  • Quess Corp: Price target of ₹1,000, potential upside of 50%. Projected revenue growth at CAGR of 12-14% till 2027.

Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on CNBCTV18.com are their own. Users are advised to check with certified experts before making investment decisions.

item.title: Nifty 50 To Correct Another 10%, Says Marcellus Investments Saurabh Mukherjea - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Nifty 50 To Correct Another 10%, Says Marcellus Investment's Saurabh Mukherjea

Date: 20 Dec 2024, Source: NDTV Profit

According to Saurabh Mukherjea, the founder and CEO of Marcellus Investment Managers, the Nifty 50 index is expected to correct by another 10% to achieve a sensible valuation. He suggests diversifying portfolios into the North American market, highlighting the high-performing nature of both markets.

  • Mukherjea emphasizes the need for caution in small and mid-cap stocks amidst increasing retail investor participation.
  • He advises that a portfolio combining Indian and North American investments could provide better diversification.
  • The current Nifty's price-to-earnings ratio is seen at 22, with a recommendation to target 18 for long-term investments.
  • Overall, Mukherjea believes the market downturn is cyclical, not structural, and encourages investors to look for opportunities in overvalued sectors.
“Leaving aside, the Covid trough, Nifty, has done around mid to high teens and is not massively overvalued.”

This analysis reflects the cyclical nature of market fluctuations and underscores the importance of strategic portfolio management during volatile periods.

item.title: Gold price falls by Rs 240 per sovereign, gram costs Rs 7,040 on Dec 20 in Chennai - DTNEXT
item.description:
Gold price falls by Rs 240 per sovereign, gram costs Rs 7,040 on Dec 20 in Chennai

Date: December 20, 2024 Source: Local News

The price of gold in Chennai has seen a decline, with costs falling by Rs 240 per sovereign, and now priced at Rs 56,320 per sovereign. Per gram, the gold price has decreased by Rs 30, bringing it to Rs 7,040.

  • Gold price on December 20: Rs 56,320 per sovereign
  • Gold price per gram: Rs 7,040
  • Previous prices: Rs 56,560 on December 19, Rs 57,200 on December 18
  • Overall trend shows slight variations in gold prices over the past week
  • Silver price decreased to Rs 98 per gram
"The price fluctuations in gold are indicative of market trends affecting consumers and investors alike."

This recent drop in gold prices reflects ongoing market dynamics, affecting both consumers and the wider economy.
